description: Erection of part four, five and six storey building providing two ground floor retail units (use class A1, A2 and A3)  and 22 self-contained residential units on the upper floors (7 one-bedroom, 13 two-bedroom and 2 three-bedroom), provision of 3 disabled car parking spaces, 1 city car club space and delivery/loading bay, cycle storage and refuse/recycling storage (amended plans received 03/01/2008 and 09/01/2008)
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason:  In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of all the buildings shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in the application. The development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure a high quality appearance appropriate to the location and surroundings; in accordance with policies 1.4, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the surface finishes to the hardsurfaced areas shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in the application. The development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained.   Reason: To ensure a satisfactory and complementary finish for this development in the interests of the visual amenities and character of the locality; in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, details of refuse storage and waste management (including provision for recycling) in accordance with adopted standards, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of any part of the development and retained permanently. This condition applies notwithstanding the details submitted with the application.  Reason: To protect the living and working conditions of occupiers of the development and to meet the Council's sustainability policies, in accordance with policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking spaces, including the disabled spaces, and the associated access and manoeuvring space hereby permitted (as shown on the approved drawings) shall all be surfaced and available for use prior to first occupation of any of the units hereby permitted and thereafter shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application. All parking shall be for use of the residents of the development and their visitors and for no other purpose.  Reason: To ensure adequate parking is provided and retained within the site in the interests of the amenities of the occupiers of the surrounding properties and in the interests of general highway safety and the free flow of traffic within the site and on the local highway, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 9.1 in the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | The cycle parking spaces shown on the approved drawings shall be provided prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, and thereafter shall be permanently retained and kept continuously available for cycle parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. All cycle parking shall be for the use of the residents of the development and their visitors and for no other purpose.  Reason: To ensure that adequate cycle parking is available within the site in accordance with policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to `Lifetime Homes Standards`, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, for any mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms from external noise and to ensure appropriate air quality. The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation of any part of the building and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development hereby approved, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Before the development is commenced, a detailed site investigation shall be carried out by a competent person to establish the extent, degree and nature of any site contamination. The method and extent of the site investigation shall be agreed with the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of any work. A written method statement for the remediation of the land and/or groundwater contamination affecting the site shall be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement and all requirements shall be implemented and completed to the satisfaction of the local planning authority by a competent person. No deviation from this scheme shall be made without the express written permission of the Local Planning Authority. Copies of a completion report confirming the objectives, methods, results and conclusions of the remediation works have been complied with shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the ground conditions are safe, in the interests of the amenities of future occupiers of the site; in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | Any fixtures, furniture, landscaping, plants and other similar features proposed to be installed on the communal roof top garden areas and private balconies must be permanently secured. No hanging of washing shall occur on any of the balconies.  Reason: In the interests of the visual amenity of the area and community safety in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development approved by this permission shall be commenced until a scheme for the provision and implementation of surface water run-off limitation by means of a sustainable drainage system shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall be implemented in accordance with the approved programme and details. The surface water runoff rates shall be established by calculations for the proposed and existing development.  Reason: To prevent the increased risk of flooding and improve water quality; in accordance with policy 2.5 in the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | Surface water source control measures shall be taken in accordance with details to be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Such measures approved shall be implemented before the development is occupied and permanently retained.  Reason: To prevent the increased risk of flooding and improve water quality; in accordance with policy 2.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | The affordable accommodation hereby approved shall be permanently retained on site and shall not be used for any other purpose, including private tenure, without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that an acceptable amount of affordable housing is maintained within the development; in accordance with policy 5.2 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information provided with the application, details of measures to provide 10 per cent of the energy requirements of the development as renewable energy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the residential units within the apartment building and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements in accordance with policy 2.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of the development a `Construction Strategy` shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Strategy should include details of access arrangements during the construction phase, material storage, site operatives parking and details of noise, vibration and dust mitigation measures. Once approved, the development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved Strategy.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The windows in the north facing elevation of the development shall be fitted with reflective glass and integral blinds prior to first occupation of the building andthereafter be permanently retained in such condition.  Reason: To safeguard the privacy of residents of the residential units from the fire station yard adjacent; in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'New Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The use of the commercial premises shall be restricted to 08:00 hours to 18:00 hours. Monday to Saturday.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measures at 1 metre from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant period of operation.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Deliveries and collections to the commercial premises should be restricted to the hours of 08:00 hours to 18:00 hours. Monday to Saturday.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and dwellings above to demonstrate that it prevents transmissionof fumes, smoke, odour and noise.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A green travel plan and/or green travel strategy document designed to manage the transport needs of staff and visitors (including details of trip generation and reduction targets) to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority for each part of the development or development as a whole, as appropriate. The approved green travel plan(s) shall be implemented on first occupation, and shall be retained in operation thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. Thereafter, an annual monitoring report (for the green travel plan(s) and/or green travel strategy document, as appropriate) shall be submitted to the local planning authority, unless otherwise requested.  Reason: to promote sustainable patterns of transport, to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 21: Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans.
